  17. (*********************** Basic functions and types *********************)

  19. (*** Miscellaneous ***)
  20. exception Out_of_range

  22. ‌let cleanup e f =
  23.   let bt = Printexc.get_raw_backtrace () in
  24.   let () = f () in
  25.   Printexc.raise_with_backtrace e bt

  27. ‌let nothing _ = ()

  29. (*** Operations on lists. ***)

  31. (* Remove an element from a list *)
  32. ‌let except e l =
  33. let rec except_e = function
  34.      [] -> []
  35.    | elem::l -> if e = elem then l else elem::except_e l
  36. in except_e l

  38. (* Position of an element in a list. Head of list has position 0. *)
  39. ‌let index a l =
  40. let rec index_rec i = function
  41.      []  -> raise Not_found
  42.   | b::l -> if a = b then i else index_rec (i + 1) l
  43. in index_rec 0 l

  45. (* Return the `n' first elements of `l' *)
  46. (* ### n l -> l' *)
  47. ‌let rec list_truncate =
  48.   fun
  49.     p0 p1 -> match (p0,p1) with (0, _)      -> []
  50.   | (_, [])     -> []
  51.   | (n, (a::l)) -> a::(list_truncate (n - 1) l)

  53. (* Separate the `n' first elements of `l' and the others *)
  54. (* ### n list -> (first, last) *)
  55. ‌let rec list_truncate2 =
  56.   fun
  57.     p0 p1 -> match (p0,p1) with (0, l) ->
  58.       ([], l)
  59.   | (_, []) ->
  60.       ([], [])
  61.   | (n, (a::l)) ->
  62.       let (first, last) = (list_truncate2 (n - 1) l) in
  63.         (a::first, last)

  65. (* Replace x by y in list l *)
  66. (* ### x y l -> l' *)
  67. ‌let list_replace x y =
  68.   let rec repl =
  69.     function
  70.       [] -> []
  71.     | a::l ->
  72.         if a == x then y::l
  73.         else a::(repl l)
  74.   in repl

  76. (*** Operations on strings. ***)

  78. (* Remove blanks (spaces and tabs) at beginning and end of a string. *)
  79. ‌let is_space = function
  80.   | ' ' | '\t' -> true | _ -> false

  82. ‌let string_trim s =
  83.   let l = String.length s and i = ref 0 in
  84.     while
  85.       !i < l && is_space (String.get s !i)
  86.     do
  87.       incr i
  88.     done;
  89.     let j = ref (l - 1) in
  90.       while
  91.         !j >= !i && is_space (String.get s !j)
  92.       do
  93.         decr j
  94.       done;
  95.       String.sub s !i (!j - !i + 1)

  97. (* isprefix s1 s2 returns true if s1 is a prefix of s2. *)

  99. ‌let isprefix s1 s2 =
  100.   let l1 = String.length s1 and l2 = String.length s2 in
  101.   (l1 = l2 && s1 = s2) || (l1 < l2 && s1 = String.sub s2 0 l1)


  104. (*** I/O channels ***)

  106. ‌type io_channel = {
  107.   io_in : in_channel;
  108.   io_out : out_channel;
  109.   io_fd : Unix.file_descr
  110.   }

  112. ‌let io_channel_of_descr fd = {
  113.   io_in = Unix.in_channel_of_descr fd;
  114.   io_out = Unix.out_channel_of_descr fd;
  115.   io_fd = fd
  116.   }

  118. let close_io io_channel =
  119.   close_out_noerr io_channel.io_out;
  120.   close_in_noerr io_channel.io_in

  122. let std_io = {
  123.   io_in = stdin;
  124.   io_out = stdout;
  125.   io_fd = Unix.stdin
  126.   }
